text: what does your mobile phone tell you
about the European Union to find out
let's put this expensive bit of kid
through an industrial shredder why are
we shredding expensive phones well to
shed some light on what the EU does and
how it works one of the union's great
achievements has been to make sure that
whatever country we travel to in the EU
we don't get hit with massive roaming
charges whenever we text or make a phone
call or use the internet for a while now
the EU has been gradually reducing the
roaming charges and from next year it's
going to ban them all together would
Britain still benefit from that if it
left the EU probably Norway Iceland and
Liechtenstein are not part of the EU
they are part of the European Economic
Area and they are also part of the
roaming charges deal switzerland however
is not hmm when a smartphone is thrown
away there are all sorts of regulations
from the EU regarding the recycling of
the rare earths and other materials
inside the phone and there are also
plenty of other EU rules on the mobile
phone networks and the type of radio
frequencies that these phones operate on
the point is that the mobile is well
just that mobile so does that mean that
the EU approach is the right one well
certainly it seems to make better sense
to bring in EU wide Europe wide rules
that govern such a borderless technology
and yet at the same time many also say
that even better would be a truly global
regulatory system
